<<<api>>>: PrintWriter.write
<<<code>>>: 
```java
// Create the file
String path = request.getSession().getServletContext().getRealPath("/");
File file = File.createTempFile("getter", ".html", new File(path + "/tmp/"));

// Write to the file
PrintWriter writer = new PrintWriter(new FileWriter(file));
writer.write("Some content");
writer.close();

// Delete the file
boolean deleteStatus = file.delete();
if(deleteStatus){
    System.out.println("File deleted successfully");
}else{
    System.out.println("Failed to delete the file");
}

// Redirect to login page
response.sendRedirect("login.jsp");
```
<<<explanation>>>: In this code, we first create a temporary file in the specified directory. Then, we use the PrintWriter.write method to write some content to the file. After writing, we close the PrintWriter to release the resources it's holding. Then, we delete the file using the File.delete method. This method returns a boolean value indicating whether the deletion was successful or not. Finally, we redirect the user to the login page using the HttpServletResponse.sendRedirect method.
